ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.test

Class ApproverTests

  • java.lang.Object
      • ca.ualberta.cmput301w15t13.test.ApproverTests

  • public class ApproverTests
extends
    This test suite tests the functionality of the application when the user is an approver. Specifically, that an approver can approve claims, comment on claims, and return claims. User stories tested: US08.07.01,US08.08.01,US08.09.01 US08.06.01,US08.03.01, US08.04.01, US08.05.01, US08.02.01 General use case can be found on the wiki at https://github.com/CMPUT301W15T13/TravelPlanner/wiki/User-Stories-and-Requirements All Tests should pass

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ApproverTests() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testApproverView()
      Test that the Approver sees the correct submitted claims Tests US08.01.01 - partly
      void testClaimApprove()
      Test Case H3 Tests that as an approver you are able to approve a claim.
      void testComment()
      Use Case H4 Approver can set one or more comments on a claim that is submitted, and cannot modify a claim that is not submitted.
      void testExpenseItemList()
      Tests the approvers ability to get the expense Items of a claim, and that they show up in the right order.
      void testReturnClaim()
      Test Case H2 Tests that as an approver you are able to return a claim Tests US08.07.01 https://github.com/CMPUT301W15T13/TravelPlanner/issues/78
      void testSorted()
      Tests that the claims the approver sees are sorted as wanted Tests US08.02.01
      void testView()
      Tests the approver interface, that they can "view" the correct information for a submitted claim, it is displayed correctly, and that the same is true for a claim's expense items.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • testClaimApprove

        public void testClaimApprove()
                      throws InvalidDateException,
                             EmptyFieldException,
                             InvalidUserPermissionException
        Test Case H3 Tests that as an approver you are able to approve a claim. In addition, our interface is designed in such a way that if you are logged in as a claimant, there is no option to approve your own claims. This has been confirmed through manual testing. Tests US08.08.01,US08.09.01 https://github.com/CMPUT301W15T13/TravelPlanner/issues/79
        Throws:
        InvalidNameException
        InvalidDateException
        EmptyFieldException
        InvalidUserPermissionException

      • testView

        public void testView()
              throws EmptyFieldException,
                     InvalidDateException,
                     DuplicateException,
                     InvalidUserPermissionException,
                     InvalidFieldEntryException
        Tests the approver interface, that they can "view" the correct information for a submitted claim, it is displayed correctly, and that the same is true for a claim's expense items. We have manually confirmed that the information is displayed. Tests US08.01.01, US08.03.01, US08.04.01, US08.05.01
